titleStmt.title: Batt upon Batt a poem upon the parts, patience, and pains of Barth. Kempster, clerk, poet, cutler, of Holy-Rood-Parish in Southampton / by a person of quality; to which is annexed The vision, wherein is described Batts person and ingenuity ... by the same author ...
titleStmt.author: Speed, John, 1628-1711.

titleStmt.title: Batt upon Batt a poem upon the parts, patience, and pains of Barth. Kempster, clerk, poet, cutler, of Holy-Rood-Parish in Southampton / by a person of quality; to which is annexed The vision, wherein is described Batts person and ingenuity ... by the same author ...
titleStmt.author: Speed, John, 1628-1711.
Speed, John, 1628-1711. Vision.

notesStmt.note: "Dedicated to the gentry of Hampshire for their diversion, but more especially to the inhabitants of Southampton."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
